intro: Halenia recurva, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture. Halenia recurva is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
